abstract: Creates a room-capture view with the given AR session.
overview:
## Discussion

By providing your own [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ARKit/ARSession] object, you can continue your app’s existing AR experience by seamlessly transitioning into a room-scanning session wtih RoomPlan. In addition, continuing an `ARSession` across multiple room-capture sessions — specifically, different rooms in the same vicinity — enables you to merge multiple [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom] objects into a single captured structure. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedStructure].

You can access the `arSession` at runtime through this class’s room-capture session ([doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureView/captureSession]) property. See the [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureSession] property [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureSession/arSession].

# init(frame:arSession:)

**Initializer**

Creates a room-capture view with the given AR session.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency init(frame: CGRect, arSession: ARSession)
```

## Parameters

- **frame**: A structure that positions and shapes the view.
- **arSession**: A world-tracking session that your app creates and runs with an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration] before calling this function. If you pass an `ARSession` instance, RoomPlan preserves all of the AR session’s settings.

## Discussion

By providing your own [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/ARKit/ARSession] object, you can continue your app’s existing AR experience by seamlessly transitioning into a room-scanning session wtih RoomPlan. In addition, continuing an `ARSession` across multiple room-capture sessions — specifically, different rooms in the same vicinity — enables you to merge multiple [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedRoom] objects into a single captured structure. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/CapturedStructure].

You can access the `arSession` at runtime through this class’s room-capture session ([doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureView/captureSession]) property. See the [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureSession] property [doc://com.apple.RoomPlan/documentation/RoomPlan/RoomCaptureSession/arSession].

## Creating a room-capture view

- **init(frame:)**: Creates a view that sizes to the specified frame.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a view by deserializing from the specified coder.
